comments.creator: honzab.moz@firemni.cz
comments.author: honzab.moz@firemni.cz
comments.raw_text:
Few days ago I have updated my mozilla-central repo after few weeks of remaining on an older changeset.

Then I tried to build (non-clobbered) with the pulled changes and I got error from check-sync-dirs.py that /build and /js/src/build dirs are not in sync.

I tried a clobbered build, nothing has changed.

I did a clean clone to a temp dir, and build worked, so it appeared to me my source tree broke.

Only difference I found in the source tree was presence of js/src/build/cl.pyc file (a compiled cl.py script) in the source tree (not in the object dir!).  After I deleted the file build started to work again.

I didn't find any reports of this, so this might be here more just for reference.

I tried a clobbered build, nothing has changed.

I did a clean clone to a temp dir, and build worked, so it appeared to me my source tree broke.

Only difference I found in the source tree was presence of js/src/build/cl.pyc file (a compiled cl.py script) in the source tree (not in the object dir!).  After I deleted the file build started to work again.

I didn't find any reports of this, so this might be here more just for reference.

24 *.pyc
